means: 错误地判断，冤枉( misjudge的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Misjudging an opponent's position is a common mistake.
sentence.Network_cn: 错误的判断对手的形势是一个常犯的错误.

list.abs: I'm sorry I misjudged you / your motives .对不起，我误会你[你的动机]了。
system of revestigating into misjudged cases ., 错案追究制度.
警务英语简明教程 Unit1-5 ... run the red light 闯红灯 misjudged case n 冤案 Chinese Criminal Code 中国刑法.
I'm sorry I misjudged you / your motives .对不起，我误会你[你的动机]了。

entry.tran: 错看;对…判断错误；对…有错误认识
entry.def: If you say that someone has misjudged a person or situation, you mean that they have formed an incorrect idea or opinion about them, and often that they have made a wrong decision as a result of this.

example.ex: Perhaps I had misjudged him, and he was not so predictable after all...
example.tran: 也许我看错了他，毕竟他不是可以让人一眼看透的人。

example.ex: As I swung down from out of my bunk, I got dizzy and misjudged the distance.
example.tran: 从铺位一跃而下的时候，我感到一阵眩晕，没掌握好高度。

auth_sentence.content: But Dutch Eurosceptic Barry Madlener accused Mr Tusk of misjudging the mood of European citizens.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Dutch Eurosceptic Barry Madlener accused Mr Tusk of misjudging the mood of European citizens.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Dutch Eurosceptic Barry Madlener accused Mr Tusk of misjudging the mood of European citizens.
